intro: Cebatha diversifolia, commonly known as the variable cebatha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which vary significantly across different populations. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Cebatha diversifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
